availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Gwin loser (Franklin County, KY, merchant and justice of the peace)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, merchant and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Married to Catharine S. Gwin. Father of Thomas J. Gwin, Susan Gwin, and Catherine “Kate” L. Gwin. Married to Julia Ann Smith Gwin in Scott County on October 27, 1853. Engaged in manufacture and trade in Franklin County in 1840. Owned one enslaved person in Franklin County in 1840. Hardware merchant in Franklin County in 1850. Employed Richard A. Bohannon as a clerk in Franklin County in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Merchant in Franklin County in 1860. Administered seven enslaved persons for Thomas Coleman in Franklin County in 1860. Justice of the peace in Franklin County in 1865. Member of the International Order of Oddfellows.
